alert.note: Alert for Anson; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:39AM EST until January 29 at 1:28AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Rocky River Near Norwood affecting Anson and Stanly Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rocky River near Norwood. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Action Stage. The river begins to overflow its banks in some areas upstream of the gage site. At 20.0 feet, Minor flood stage. There is significant overflow into adjacent pasture and lowlands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Sunday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EST Sunday was 21.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 6.4 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.9 feet on 11/13/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Rocky River Norwood 20.0 20.9 Sun 9 am EST 11.4 8.0 7.0 6.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EST.
